intro: Sasa palmata var. kurokawana, commonly known as the Kurokawa bamboo, is a variant of the Sasa palmata species native to Japan. It is characterized by its slender, upright culms that are typically dark green to black in color. The plant has narrow, lance-shaped leaves that are arranged in a dense,丛生 (clumped) growth pattern. It thrives in shaded, moist environments such as forests and mountainous regions. Its botanical features make it a valuable ornamental and ecological plant in its native habitat.
